channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2023070609
item.description:
Report X-2023070609

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: WHITSETT
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found to be leaking from the bottom of the plastic 5 gallon container during the preload sort. Container had then been moved into a blue hazmat bag and placed in a yellow container away from other packages. DescribePack: Failure occurred because of insufficient outer covering for the plastic container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the container had been removed from other packages and placed in a blue hazmat bag, and a yellow container to keep the spill contained.

item.title: Report X-2023070144
item.description:
Report X-2023070144

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-28T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO US IN A LINED TOTE BY THE BULK AREA MANAGER. THEY FOUND IT UNDER THE BELT IN A LINED TOTE AND NOTICED THAT IT WAS LEAKING. WE INSPECTED IT AND MADE SURE TO ISOLATE THIS IN THE HAZMAT CAGE DescribePack: 6 LOOSE CAPS WITH WEEP HOLES DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WE ISOLATED THIS PACKAGE IN THE HAZMAT CAGE AS SOON AS WE ASSESED THE CONDITION OF THE PACKAGE AND ITS CONTENTS.

item.title: Report X-2023070135
item.description:
Report X-2023070135

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-28T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS LOCATED IN THE 281 UNLOAD AND WAS DENTED ON ONE SIDE AND THE TOP APPEARED WET AS IF IT HAD LEAKED. THE CAP ON TOP WAS LOOSE AT THAT POINT AND PKG COULD NOT BE MOVED FORWARD. DescribePack: DENT ON SIDE OF CAN MUST HAVE CAUSED CAP ON TOP TO LOOSEN AND BECOME UNSEALED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS TAKEN TO QA WHERE IT WAS SECURED AND INSPECTED FURTHER.

item.title: Report X-2023061728
item.description:
Report X-2023061728

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-27T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was damaged during delivery transit. When delivery truck returned, the package was located within the truck and placed into a Hazardous Materials bag to contain it. Once contained within the bag, the bag was moved to a transport cart for it be secured within the hazmat processing area for further examination and processing. Delivery truck was further looked over for any spillage within the truck, but none was found. DescribePack: Package failure was caused by an unsecure cap that caused the hazardous material bottle to leak/release into the shipping carton. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was secured once discovered within a Hazardous Materials bag and transported to the Hazmat processing area away from general personel.
